Robyn Burger

rlb388 at cornell dot edu

CV

Hello! My name is Robyn. I am a first year M.S. student at Cornell University where I am fortunate to be advised by Paul Gölz and Sid Banerjee. My research is at the intersection of theoretical computer science and ORIE. These days, I am most interested in algorithmic game theory, particularly, social choice.

In May, I graduated Cornell University with majors in mathematics and computer science. My amazing advisors for undergraduate research were Matt Eichhorn and Anke van Zuylen.

I love learning new things, meeting new people, and am always happy to chat!

Publications and Presentations

EssentCell: Discovering Essential Evolutionary Relations in Noisy Single-Cell Data [arxiv]
Adiesha Liyanage, Robyn Burger, Allison Shi, Braeden Sopp, Binhai Zhu, Brendan Mumey
IEEE/ACM Transactions on Computational Biology and Bioinformatics 2026

Approximating the Longest K-Repeated Subsequence Approximation Algorithm [PDF]
Robyn Burger, Matthew Eichhorn, Anke van Zuylen
University of Michigan Theory Seminar (12/24)
